content.description:
Tum, pietatepietas, -tatis, f.: loyalty gravem ac meritismeritum, -i, n.: merit si forte virum quem 
conspexere, silentsileo, -ere: to be quiet, arrectisarrigo, -ere, -rexi, -rectum: to raiseque auribus adstantadsto, -are = sto, -are.
content.question: In the sentence, what does auribus mean?

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
